tn.text: See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]]
Here the word "he" refers to Pashur.
Possible meanings are 1) that Pashhur himself beat Jeremiah or 2) that Pashhur ordered other men to beat Jeremiah. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Stocks are a wooden frame with holes in it that people use to lock up a prisoner's hands, feet, and head.
This gate is different from the gate in the city wall that shared the same name.
This phrase is used here to mark where the action starts. If your language has a way for doing this, you could consider using it here.
This name means "terror on every side" or "surrounded by terror." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
AT: "Take note to what I am about to tell you"

tn.ref: they will fall by the sword of their enemies
tn.text: AT: "their enemies will kill them with swords" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
AT: "you will see it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: I will give all of Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon
tn.text: Here the word "hand" refers to power. AT: "I will enable the king of Babylon to conquer all of Judah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here the word "him" refers to the king of Babylon.

tn.ref: all the wealth ... all of its riches, all of its precious items and all the treasures
tn.text: Yahweh repeats the same basic idea four times for emphasis. That is Babylon will take away all the wealth of Israel, including the King's possessions. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: I will place these things in the hand of your enemies
tn.text: Here the word "hand" refers to possession. AT: "I will allow your enemies to take possession of these things" or "I will give these things to your enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: You and all of your loved ones to whom you prophesied deceitful things will be buried there
tn.text: AT: "There, people will bury you and all of your loved ones to whom you prophesied deceitful things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Jeremiah Speaks to Yahweh
This can be stated in active form. AT: "You indeed deceive me" (UDB) or "you really did deceive me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: You deceived me, Yahweh. I was indeed deceived
tn.text: Some modern versions interpret these Hebrew expressions as "You persuaded me, Yahweh. I was indeed persuaded."
This is a person whom others laugh at and make fun of.

tn.ref: The people mock me every day, all the day
tn.text: This phrase means basically the same thing as the previous phrase. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
These two phrases mean basically the same thing and emphasize that he proclaimed Yahweh's message boldly. AT: "openly proclaimed" or "proclaimed loudly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: Yahweh's word has become for me reproach and mocking every day
tn.text: Here "word" refers to the message of Yahweh. AT: "People reproach and mock me every day because I proclaim Yahweh's message" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

The words "reproach" and "mocking" mean basically the same thing and emphasize that people have ridiculed Jeremiah for proclaiming Yahweh's message. AT: "a reason for people to ridicule me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: I will no longer proclaim his name
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "I will no longer say anything about him" (UDB) or 2) "I will no longer speak as his messenger" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: it is like a fire in my heart, held within my bones
tn.text: Jeremiah speaks of Yahweh's message as if it were an uncontrollable fire. AT: "Yahweh's word is like a fire that burns deep within me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Jeremiah's enemies say these words.

tn.ref: Perhaps he can be tricked ... take our revenge on him
tn.text: Jeremiah's enemies say these words.
"Perhaps we can trick him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Yahweh is with me like a powerful warrior
tn.text: Yahweh is like a powerful warrior who protects Jeremiah and defeats his enemies. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
"people will never forget it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: who see the mind and the heart
tn.text: AT: "who knows what people think and desire" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: rescued the lives of those who are oppressed
tn.text: AT: "rescued oppressed people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here the word hand refers to power. AT: "from the power of evildoers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Jeremiah continues speaking to Yahweh.

tn.ref: Let the day when I was born be cursed
tn.text: AT: "Curse the day I was born" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Do not let the day that my mother bore me be blessed
tn.text: AT: "Do not bless the day that my mother bore me." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Let the man who informed my father be cursed
tn.text: AT: "Curse the man who informed my father" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This refers to the man who informed Jeremiah's father of Jeremiah's birth.
This refers to Sodom and Gomorrah.
Here the word "he" refers to Yahweh.

tn.ref: May he hear a call for help
tn.text: Here the word "he" refers to "that man."
Jeremiah's mother's womb would have held his dead body like tombs hold the bodies of dead people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Why is it that I came out from the womb to see troubles and agony ... shame?
tn.text: Jeremiah uses this question to complain that there was no good reason for him to be born. AT: "There was no reason for me to be born only to see troubles and agony ... shame." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
The words "troubles" and "agony" mean basically the same thing and emphasize the amount and severity of suffering. AT: "to experience so much suffering." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: my days are filled with shame
tn.text: AT: "my life is filled with shame" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
